title: Wind and Rain Batter Japanese Island as Typhoon Lingling Moves Toward Korea
text:
Typhoon Lingling hit the Japanese island of Miyakojima on September 5, bringing strong rain and winds that toppled trees and utility poles. Five people were injured, local media reported.

The storm was also reported to have caused floods.

This footage was described as showing rain lashing an area on the southern coast of Miyakojima as the storm passed over on September 5.

The Japanese Meteorological Agency (JMA) said on September 6 that Typhoon Lingling was moving toward the Korean Peninsula and was expected to make landfall there on the morning of September 7. Credit: @x_724/ via Storyful
